data.name: therapiedecken
data.heading: TherapieDecken.de
description: Senso-Rex, the company behind TherapieDecken.de has been producting weighed blankets since 2013.

As the main IT memeber in charge of the store, I brough my advice and ideas for the new design and setup of the store, initially I would sketch the new features on Figma to later develop them, but as the load of work increased, I worked with a great team of designers, as well with the marketing team.

In this way, I would receive the designs and then develop them, some features and UI was proposed and designed by me. At the end every new feature and design needed to be checked and approved by me before my manager, with the responsibility of having a functional and responsive website.
data.shortDescription: Therapiedecken is an online Shopify store that sells weighed blankets as their main products.

description: Offers an automated litter box that filters climps into a waste drawer, leaving the work of cleaning the cat toilets to a robot.

As the main IT member, I got the task to set the first store and design the look of the UI, later on, the new team of designers were in charge of the rest of the deisng and I would develop the design changes.

data.name: Inmyshoes
data.heading: inmyshoes app
data.shortDescription: inmyshoes is a personal project that collects worries from people, taking in consideration their age to later show a data visualization with the list of worries for other people, older than the author of the worry, to give an advice. The application uses an autentication code to determine if verify the email of the user. There is a NodeJs server that uses the Express library as well, this server gets the API requests from the frontend and stores or retrieves the data. The data is stored in SQL tables. Another implemented featured is the use of OpenAI which after submitting the worry, creates an automatic summary of it which is shown in the data visualization

tasks.title: Graph development

data.name: Web Porfolio
data.heading: Karen Delgado - Graphic Designer
data.shortDescription: This is a portfolio website for Karen Delgado, I used a React template and modified its initial structure with the use of NextJs and Tailwind which were already implemented in the templated. To deploy the website I created an image with Docker and deployed it in a free account on Netlify
